title: A Healthy Diet and Lifestyle for your Immune System
description: Simple life strategies to boost your immune system and fight off infections more quickly. A healthy diet, sufficient sleep and some light exercise are key.
cleaned_text: A Healthy Diet and Lifestyle for your Immune System The human body's immune system is its best defense against disease. It is also needed to help the body recover from injuries. However, there are a variety of factors that can result in a compromised immune system. The first step to facing these potential problems is to identify them. Some of the factors that can weaken the immune system include stress, bad eating habits, lack of sleep, and unhealthy lifestyle habits. These can lead to regular sickness and [symptoms](https://www.thecandidadiet.com/candida-symptoms/) that can prevent you from living your life to the fullest. Eating Right Eating the right foods and getting the proper nutrition are the keys to a healthy immune system. Vitamins E and C, probiotics, beta-glucans, catechins, and soluble fiber all help build up immune cells that help boost the immune system. The live microorganisms found in yogurt are known as probiotic bacteria. These 'good bacteria' help to restore the balance in your gut and prime your immune system to defend itself against pathogenic organisms. Probiotic foods are one of the [most important elements in the anti Candida diet](https://www.thecandidadiet.com/anti-candida-diet/), and indeed any healthy diet. Some of the best [foods to eat](https://www.thecandidadiet.com/foodstoeat.htm) include soluble fibers that help fight inflammation. They can be found in foods such as cucumber, celery, nuts and beans. Fava beans are a rich source of catechins, which have been found to improve one's immune response as well. Beta-glucans, which can be found in mushrooms, and the selenium in seafood both boost the immune system. [Maintaining a Strong Immune System During Cold and Flu Season](http://www.fshn.hs.iastate.edu/nutritionclinic/handouts/newsletters/Wellness-Eating_to_Boost_your_Immunity.pdf) [Nine Power Foods that Boost Immunity](http://www.prevention.com/food/food-remedies/9-power-foods-boost-immunity) [Ten Top Immune Boosting Foods](http://www.labrada.com/blog/diets-nutrition/top-10-immune-boosting-foods/) Reduce Stress Chronic stress has the ability to make the body more susceptible to infection by reducing its white blood cell count. In addition, it reduces the strength of T-cells, which are another important part of the immune system. Moreover, stress causes the body to redistribute immune system cells to the skin and lymph nodes, taking them away from the rest of the body, where an infection like [Candida](https://www.thecandidadiet.com/about-candida/) may be lurking. One key method for reducing stress includes avoiding conversations, people, environments or situations which are reliable sources of stress. Reducing one's number of chores and trimming to-do lists is another major stress reduction technique. [How to Boost Your Immune System - Stress Less](http://www.shape.com/lifestyle/mind-and-body/how-boost-your-immune-system?page=4) [Stress Weakens the Immune System](http://www.apa.org/research/action/immune.aspx) [Effects on the Immune System](http://umm.edu/health/medical/reports/articles/stress) Healthy Living Living a healthy and active lifestyle is critical to [improving one's immune system](https://www.thecandidadiet.com/immune-boosters/). One way to do that is to put a stop to harmful habits such as smoking or excessive alcohol consumption. Positive healthy steps that people should adopt include drinking plenty of water and frequent hand washing. Dehydration allows pathogens to enter the body and is problematic to the body's defense system. People who have chronic health problems, such as diabetes or high blood pressure, should work with their physician to keep their condition under control. [6 Ways to Boost Your Immune System](http://healthcare.utah.edu/healthfeed/postings/2014/01/011514_immune_boost.php) [How to Boost Your Immune System - Adopt Healthy Living Strategies](http://www.health.harvard.edu/flu-resource-center/how-to-boost-your-immune-system.htm) [Top Ten Practical Tips to Boost Your Immune System](http://www.beaumont.edu/press/news-stories/2008/10/top-10-practical-tips-to-boost-your-immune-system/) Exercise Exercising in moderation can help give the immune system a boost. Approximately twenty minutes of exercise a day is sufficient to take advantage of the benefits. White blood cells, which combat bacteria and viruses, travel throughout the body faster when a person exercises. In addition, exercise lowers the hormones that are released as a result of stress. Elevated body heat from exercise may also reduce the amount of bacterial growth. It is important to note that too much exercise can have the opposite effect and reduce one's immune response. Healthy Weight Excess weight and obesity have been found to aggravate a number of problems, including heart disease. In addition obesity is detrimental to the immune system and prevents it from protecting the body the way that it should. Exercising and a healthy diet are not only a good way to reduce one's weight, but also improve the performance of the immune system. Even moderate weight loss is capable of significantly strengthening the human body's ability to fight off diseases. [Follow this Eat Right Plan to Keep Your Immune System Healthy](http://www.cnn.com/2007/HEALTH/diet.fitness/11/14/cl.best.defense/index.html) [The Immune System - Keep the Immune System Healthy](http://umaine.edu/ccids/files/2011/01/immune.pdf) [Lose Weight and Boost Immunity](http://tuftsjournal.tufts.edu/2010/05_2/features/04/) Be Social One of the more unexpected ways to improve one's immunity is to socialize more frequently. It may seem that socializing more would increase one's chances of becoming ill, but according to professional studies the opposite is true. These studies indicate that people who socialize were less likely to get sick or stayed sick for a shorter period. People who were more solitary, however, had weaker immune systems. [Ten Immune System Boosters and Busters](http://www.webmd.com/cold-and-flu/10-immune-system-busters-boosters) [Twelve Strategies to Strengthen Your Immune System - Socialize More](http://www.motherearthnews.com/natural-health/strengthen-immune-system-z10m0vau.aspx?PageId=2#ArticleContent) [Tips to Strengthen Your Immune System/Build a Strong Social Network](http://www.emedicinehealth.com/slideshow_pictures_strengthen_your_immune_system/article_em.htm) Sleep Soundly When a person does not get enough sleep, he or she is more susceptible to illness from viruses and bacteria. In addition, the time needed for recovering from these conditions may also take longer if a person has not received an adequate amount of sleep. Ideally, for maximum benefit an adult should receive no less than seven hours of sleep a day. The amount of sleep needed rises the younger a person is. For example, a teen should get between nine and ten hours of restful sleep, while younger children should aim for at least ten.
